p: Among the basal media tested, a combination of MS and auxins was the best to induce callus formation of P. bullata ( Figure 1) compared to a combination of WPM and auxins ( Figure 2). The MS medium supplemented with 30 µM dicamba exhibited the highest fresh weight (1180.00 ± 159.43 mg FW) ( Figure 1k) after three weeks of culture followed by MS + 20 µM picloram after four weeks of culture (1024.00 ± 158.15 mg FW) ( Figure 1i), MS + 50 µM IBA after six weeks of culture (864.00 ± 74.84 mg FW) ( Figure 1c), MS + 30 µM 2,4-D after five weeks of culture (766.00 ± 46.66 mg FW) ( Figure 1g), MS + 20 µM IAA after six weeks of culture (611.00 ± 50.54 mg FW) ( Figure 1e), and MS + 40 µM NAA after six weeks of culture (434.33 ± 27.79 mg FW) ( Figure 1a).
